name: RDFS: Erasure-code cloud storage system
short_description: Recently Google and Microsoft announced new generations of file systems based on erasure codes for lowering the storage costs. Now an open-sourced distributed file system named Raid Distributed File System (RDFS) is published by researchers in National University of Defense Technology. RDFS is a POSIX-compatible cloud storage system that achieves high availability through erasure codes. RDFS can replace the HDFS file system in the Hadoop system. The novel feature is its highly-efficient data repairs for multiple simultaneous failures that recover lost data based on the topology-aware tree structured reconstruction. RDFS permits a wide classes of coding algorithms for the repairing purposes. Further, this system optimizes the coding operations through adaptively parallel threads.
summary: RDFS: an erasure code based cloud storage system
